history.content: See: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower. The students waitlisted either 1) do not fall into a category for being able to directly enroll in the class or 2) the number of reserved seats are filled. If any of the information in the enrollment policy section applies to you, this is why you are waitlisted. I am assuming the waitlist will be processed once Phase 2 is over, space permitting.

children.subject: Priority must be given to those who are intending to declare the CS major (ie currently undeclared). Unfortunately minors do not receive enrollment priority for any course.

I should have emphasized that I am planning to declare the CS major, and in the case that I run out of time, I will only minor. Again, this rule seems extremely unfair to penalize me for specifically having declared another major already.

Definitely see your points. However, you should realize that you already have a major and are on track to graduate with something whereas the reserved seats are for students who don't have a major yet. I agree that it sucks that you cannot be included in the reserved seats categories but due to natural limitations caused by UC Berkeley being a public school, lines have to be drawn somewhere. I guess the EECS department decided to draw that line at the boundary of "necessity" and "nice to have" which I completely agree with.

Okay, reading that, it seems that I was waitlisted because I am going to be a third year student, but I have already declared another L&S major, whereas " third year undergraduates who are undeclared L&S students would be treated similarly for Fall semester classes only and then only for CS 61C and CS 70." I don't understand why students in my situation get penalized just for having declared a major already. I am trying to complete a CS minor, and not being able to take CS70 this semester will make it extremely difficult for me to complete this major on time.

I've also been placed far back in the waitlist, and I am going to be an undeclared L&S second-year. I'm not incredibly worried about it, but the system does still seem unclear, and it seems like the only real option is to wait until end of Phase II processing

history.content: I was wondering why I was waitlisted for CS70 and why there is a waitlist of over 100 students, even though there are so many open spots left in the class. Will everyone on the waitlist be let in eventually?
history.subject: Waitlisted for CS70
